snippet: The Federal Trade Commission said on Monday that it would require Johnson & Johnson to sell its system for surgically treating serious wrist fractures as a condition of approval for the company's proposed $21.3 billion acquisition of Synthes.
abstract: The Federal Trade Commission said on Monday that it would require Johnson & Johnson to sell its system for surgically treating serious wrist fractures as a condition of approval for the company's proposed $21.3 billion acquisition of Synthes.
